alert.note: Alert for Eastern Monmouth; Mercer; Middlesex; Ocean; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 3:16PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Ocean, southeastern Mercer, Monmouth and southern Middlesex Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 316 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sayreville to near Mercerville-Hamilton Square. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Trenton, Middletown, Old Bridge, East Brunswick, Sayreville, Marlboro, Manalapan, Ewing, Tinton Falls, Holmdel, Red Bank, Keansburg, Matawan, Jamesburg, Hightstown, Highlands, Cranbury, Allentown, Roosevelt and Brownville. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 8 and 9. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 2 and 21. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 62 and 69. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 107 and 124. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Monmouth; Mercer; Middlesex; Ocean; Western Monmouth
